title: Should I file a report (a person kicking my car as I drove by)?
self_text: I was driving on a residential street near where I live, at night. The park area next to it is the site of the highest concentration of homeless encampments in town, and there are frequently people acting strange in the area, drunk or strung out or just struggling with untreated mental illness. Anyway, there was a guy walking slowly in the middle of the oncoming lane. Long hair and a beard, I assumed he was one of the local homeless.   He wasn't crossing, just walking down the street in the middle of the oncoming lane. I remember thinking that he should be careful, as people coming the other way might not see him. As I drove past, he lunged towards my car and kicked the rear door as it went by.  I was shocked.  I looked in my rear view and he was continuing down the street like nothing had happened. I was afraid to stop and get into an altercation, so I kept going. I'm quite confident that I didn't hit him, as he kicked the rear door panel, and didn't hit my rear-view mirror. I saw him from a ways off, and he clearly lunged towards me as I approached.   Obviously, I'm pissed that he put a big dent in my door, and I'd like to report it, but two things are stopping me:   First,  I'm afraid the police might assume I was spinning the story. He  did  make contact with my car while it was moving, and I didn't stop. Could this constitute a hit-and-run?   Second, I have fuck-all for a description. Again, this area is like ground zero for disturbed street people. The cops likely wouldn't care even if I had a description, which I don't. But on the other hand, on the extremely small chance that the guy decided to report it, would it look bad if I didn't file a report?  Edit: I'm definitely buying a dash cam after this. Some friends have suggested that this might be an aborted fraud attempt, and I'm thinking they may be right.

title: Our entire building is bed bug infested, the management knew about it for months, but did nothing about it. My roommates and I want to take them to housing court, but are broke and have no idea where to start. Any Advice?
self_text: I made a post about the bed bug situation in more detail in another sub, so if you're looking for more details please refer to that post. Below is a summary of what we're dealing with:  Edit: we live in BROOKLYN, NYC.   My 2 roommates and I recently discovered that we had a bedbug infestation in our New York City apt. It has been beyond hell and beyond anything we could have imagined.  To top it all off, our apt neighbor told us that she has seen a bunch of other tenants throwing out bug bed infested furniture. She told us that she reached out to management at the beginning of September to warn them about a infestation in the building. She sent pictures of infested furniture that was moved outside our apt building and complained that she'd seen a dead bed bug in her apt. She started living out of bags as a precaution because she saw the bed bug in her apt. The exterminator refused to treat her apt because he says that he has to see a bed bug to do anything.  The entire building is infested  and the management won‚Äôt do anything about it. They won‚Äôt treat your apt unless they see a bed bug, they gaslight you and belittle your struggle and take months to fix the problem. Someone had to come at-least 8 times to fix our mouse problems (it is still not resolved we saw another mouse a 2 days ago) because no one cares nor have they ever tried to do a thorough job. The only reason why they have treated our apt is because we have threatened to call 311 a number of times and actually have a few times.   We regrettable signed papers after every treatment they have given us, but we will not sign anything any longer.   This is the same building that had been leaving and dumping hundreds of garbage bags worth of trash in the court yard (which they cleaned up after we called 311). People are stealing packages and there are so many issues in the apt.  After an overwhelming amount of people suggested we go to housing court( not only on our previous post, but from 311 directly, my therapist, and other friends ) we've decided to pursue legal action if possible.   We have no idea how to go about this nor do we know what resources are afforded to us. Last night we put notes on every doorstep of the tenants in the building informing them that we were pursing legal action. We provided an email and phone number that they could call to send us picture and video evidence of an the  infestation in the apt and negligence. We also advised them to call 311 and make a compliant.   We are fighting for actual maintenance of the building, care for the residents, An actually caring thorough and good exterminator for the entire building, and financial compensation for the damaged property due to the bed bugs, mice and roaches, the time it has taken to treat this infestation and the cost of washing and drying all of our clothes, our security deposit back, and any other financial compensation that we can get.  I called 311 again and made 6 complaints today 3 for our apt and 3 for the building. I am really nervous about what they are going to do next. They have been neglecting us for over a year now and we are tired of it.   We are fighting for not only ourselves, but for the people in the building who have lived under this abusive management for years. Enough is enough. Any advice or direction to resources would be very helpful thank you so much for your support!  TLDR: Our building is infested with bed bugs, management knew about it for months and did nothing and now it has spread to our apt. We are seeking to pursue legal action and take them to housing court.

title: Feeling conflicted on this one
self_text: So my boyfriend (26m) went on his first work trip. I (26f) was happy for him to get to do this and trusted him to be responsible and respectful while away.   He was distant on this trip and I told myself it was because he was busy working and learning so I didn‚Äôt message too much and just waited for his updates.   During this time I was home and got the sniffles and was a little under the weather. The last night of the trip, was the worst with communication. He told me that he and his boss were going to a bar and I told him to be safe and have fun but careful fun with his boss as at the end of the day he is still his boss.   That was at 11pm. I didn‚Äôt hear anything else and it turned to 1am and I just sent a text making sure he was okay before I headed to bed. He said that they were still at the bar and that he was leaving soon. Cool.   Fast forward to a week later, he‚Äôs on a work call in front of me and his boss starts talking about the fun they had at a strip club. This was news to me and he immediately took the phone off of speaker and turned the volume down.   I immediately knew the night he said they were at a bar was the night that they were actually at a strip club and he refrained from telling me. He claims his boss dragged him there and they stayed for hours despite him knowing that this is something I would not totally be okay with which is why he kept it from me.   I‚Äôve been feeling like this was a breach of trust. Maybe I am overthinking but I feel unable to trust him after that. It would‚Äôve been different if he just told me himself‚Ä¶ but the fact that he was trying so hard to keep it a secret and I found out the way that I did is what really is throwing me off.

title: You have intuition for a reason
self_text: Hey y'all, as a chronic over thinker ( something that  I've been trying to curb when it comes to dating) I just wanted to share my story and maybe it can help me and some other people out.  Just a back story on my history, I've had a interesting experience with OLD.  I'm 28(m)  have been on Hinge on and off for the better part of 4 years, which has led to one of my longest LTR of my whole life (just over 2 1/2 years) Overall not a terrible experience but not the greatest either.  I met a someone on Hinge about 2 months ago and things went well from the start, gave her my number on the app and we set up a great first date. She was immediately attracted to me and I found her to be very attractive, our chemistry was insane (first 5 dates we were complimented everytime by a stranger on how well we looked together and our energy towards one another). We set up a few more dates and I was really starting to like this girl with some healthy hesitation to guard the ol Blood pumper (heart).  I wanted to figure out her dating goals early on because I feel it sets the best precedent early on for communication and for what  both party's are looking for. On the 3rd date I asked what she was looking for and her "dating intentions"  She said she  was looking for something  long term and has not had many dates on hinge, just uses it to see what's out there but overall she hadn't had the best experience with OLD.  We  both seemed to be in the same spot both out of our  2 year LTR relationship's ended about 4 months prior. And the topic of exes was short clear and concise. Mine ended way before it actually ended and she expressed the same to me.  Two months go by we are seeing each other 1-3 times a week holding hands, cuddling and getting horizontal (lol). She met my closest  friends, she thought they were amazing and vice versa. Overall things were going great and moving in the right direction.  Last week I get invited by her to a double date with one of her best friends(latter told I passed the friend test they really liked me), it was a great time. When we get back to my place I  ask how she feels about what we have going on, immediately I feel the whole vibe shift. She tells me she is super into me and likes me so much but is fucked up from her past relationship and makes her question her judgment about herself and potential relationships. She asked are you over your ex? I responded "I am Absolutely over my Ex  but I totally get the hesitation I'm down to just keep doing what we are doing and see what happens".  We had plans set up for today (11/18/2022) with her same friend group I met the other night and overall really looking forward to it.  We go 2 days  no texting which isn't out of the normal. I'm not huge on texting all the time and neither is she. I texted her to see if she wanted to grab dinner before Friday the 18th, she responded "yes!" and "I'm so excited".  About 1 hour later I get the dreaded "It's not you, It's me, I really need to figure my shit out before I start dating"....absolutely shook me and caught me so off guard.  I responded with something along the lines of  "Can I please have my belongings back at some point,  I really enjoyed our time together Thank you for being honest and  I totally get it you have to look out for what's best for you, good luck and take care". Its been 2 days and no response and I'm counting my belongings as a loss.  For some reason this hit me harder than some of my past "flings" maybe because of how much we had in common and we just meshed. I came to realize  I'm sad about the "what could have been" rather than reality.  In reality some people think they are ready to date fresh out of a relationship until they find someone who is datable and the shit becomes real...real fast. I had so much anxiety leading up to me asking how she thought things were going, I just had a strange feeling she might not be over her ex. And was calling my friends the next day telling them I might have fucked this up. Thank god I didn't wait until 6 months down the line just to be hurt more  I'm going to keep dating and live my life, maybe in a couple months I'll make a bad decision and see what's she's up to and get let down again lmao

title: No one got me a present on my birthday.
self_text: I always thought I was a good friend. Our friend group was always close, we fooled around a lot, been through band camp, AP classes, and drama together. I‚Äôve known some of them since elementary school. I remembered all of their birthdays and got them presents that I knew they would like. I barely spend any money on myself, most of what I spend is on them. There was no drama between us. We were all chill, laughing, the type of group that everyone thinks is kinda weird but we don‚Äôt really mind. On everyone‚Äôs birthday we tell them happy birthday over on discord on midnight, and tease them about it the next day at school. We give presents, buy them snacks, we have a fun time. Sometimes they have a party and we chill at their place, playing games and eating food. But on my birthday, nothing like that happened. They shared a happy birthday over on discord, and the next day at school was chill, but there was a distinct lack of presents. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I‚Äôm not a greedy guy. I know that birthdays are more about the spirit and the atmosphere, but I don‚Äôt know. Maybe a small part of me hoped that they would repay me what I have given them. The entire day, exactly one person told me that they couldn‚Äôt afford to get me anything, and there as not so much as a birthday card given to me. I know this is a petty thing to be upset over, but I always thought that I was a big part in their lives. That I was worth at least a card with time and effort put into it. I tried holding on hope. Maybe they forgot their presents at home? But after a few days, that turned out to not be the case. I don‚Äôt show them I‚Äôm upset about it, and they haven‚Äôt mentioned it at all. I think I need to let this out off my chest. Maybe a small part of me is hoping that one of them sees this and talks to me about it. I don‚Äôt know. I know this is a small thing to get fussed about but it meant a lot to me. Sorry, I needed to share this. Advice is appreciated.

title: I suspect my friend‚Äôs SO is cheating on her. How should I tell her?
self_text: So, a little backround. One of my (29F) best friends (30F, let‚Äôs call her Jane) has been in a relationship for the past 10 (?) months with Jack (40sM). Jane has been through a lot in the past years, between health, family and love problems she has had quite some issues and it has been very difficult to deal with it all. For her and everyone around her.   It is also important to know that Jane has always wanted to be in relationship, and often times does everything in her power (even bending, subjugating herself and trying too hard) to make things work. Things always ended with her heartbroken.   So after finally ending a very toxic in the begining of the year, she met and quickly fell in love with Jack and their relationship became quite serious way too soon. Nonetheless, we were all very happy for her.   Recently our group of friends has started to notice red flags. For exemple, he walk by us in a neighbour city with female company and would pretend to not see us. He also refuses to post pictures online (or even be tagged) with Jane.  Our suspcions have started to confirm themselves when a friend of Jane‚Äôs (who works in the same place as Jack) started hearing rumours and conversations about Jack with other women.  Well, Jane‚Äôs friend had told us she would spill the beans but wanted to catch Jack ‚Äúin the act‚Äù, but now has said she won‚Äôt say a word because she says Jane can get suicidal or even have a regression in her disease, but also because she doesn‚Äôt want to deal with the drama.   Me and my friends feel like it is time for us to step up and talk to Jane to let her know what is happening but we don‚Äôt really know how to approach her. For many times I have relied on Reddit‚Äôs helpful insights and I am hoping to do so one more time.   Should we tell her what is going on? How should we do so?  Edit: clarity.

title: AITA for confronting neighbourhood ding-dong-dashers?
self_text: Just to be clear if "ding-dong-dash" is country specific, I am talking about when children ring doorbells and run away.  I (F29) am a SAHM with a sick toddler and a newborn at the moment. My husband (M31) took some time off work when the baby was born, but has since gone back, so it is just the babies in the house day-to-day. Safe to say, I am not particularly well-rested at the moment, and the house is a bit chaotic.  Today being Saturday, my husband said that he would help me catch up on some of the chores while I got some rest. I was really grateful, it has been a tough week. Unfortunately, some kids in the neighbourhood must have taken advantage of the good weather and thought to play ding-dong-dash.  The first incident was funny, the second time was mildly irritating, but I was downright frustrated by the sixth time. The baby and the toddler were both woken/disturbed each time, and I didn't get any of the rest that I was so looking forward to. I decided that I would help my husband with chores seeing as I was up anyway.  The seventh ding-dong-dash just so happened to be when I was vaccumming the hallway, so I got to the door before the kids were gone. There were two young boys, I would say six or seven, and they got a massive shock when I opened the door.  To be clear, I was firm but I was by no means shouting or hostile. I asked them what they thought was funny about disturbing my family, and one of them responded that I was not their mom. I said back, "I am not, but I don't think she would want to be disturbed either." After that, they turned and ran away. It was a very brief interaction.  Later, a man identifying himself as the boys' dad knocked on the door and said I made the boys cry. He said that it was children being children, they weren't hurting anyone, and my comment about their mom being disturbed was uncalled for seeing as she had passed away. He said that I made them both cry all afternoon and they are afraid of playing in the neighbourhood anymore. He also said that he could not believe I "lay in wait for them."  I explained that I was sick and tired of the doorbell going off, but he said that I should just disarm it if some ringing disturbs my family that much. I feel like I am entitled to a doorbell, but that I shouldn't have to deal with constant ringing.

title: Broken up for 4 years already
self_text: So I just found myself sobbing like crazy. I can‚Äôt breathe and just can‚Äôt stop crying. He‚Äôs my first love and damn, I loved him hard. It was an unhealthy additive love too. Now looking back I was such a possessive and passive aggressive person and hating myself for it. I don‚Äôt know what to do right now, I just want to be okay. Just okay not thinking about him anymore. He is happy now with his girlfriend of 2 years. Yes I know how long they‚Äôve been together because we kept in touch , we were good friends (like I was with him whenever he‚Äôs in a dark place) but I cut him off last year only for universe to make fun of us and let us meet and talk again on this anon site. I drove us back from the lake this weekend 2 1/2 hours and I did try but old habits die hard and my wife was back seat driving the entire way home. I mean literally anytime I took my hands off from taking a drink or itching something it was "two hands on the wheel" üòë So tonight I am driving us home from an awesome date night and 5 mins from home I'm making a turn when she harshly says two hands on the wheel. I said I was turning and started to get frustrated when she basically blamed me for feeling sick when I drive her. I say fine simple solution, we can drive separately or you can drive me. Problem Solved. Absolutely Not because she hates driving herself.  A huge argument that I feel is ridiculous. I don't mind driving all the time but who likes a back seat driver. I said I don't really think it's up to me to figure that out but if she must say something, be gentle, be cautious of your tone and what you say??? But in her head the way she is doing it is the only way to fix "my problem". title: WIBTA if I refuse to have Christmas at my brother‚Äôs house?
self_text: Burner account. My brother (M36) moved away about an hour drive, he lives there with his wife and kids (3,1). His entire family works from home. I (F32) work in healthcare and have to commute 15+hrs a week. My husband has also been having health issues over the past 18 months which have been very difficult, physically and emotionally for us to deal with.  We‚Äôve been having arguments about family visits- my brother would like me to go over every week or every other week which is difficult for us to do that regularly. I‚Äôve asked if we could have it so that we drive over once a month and they drive down once a month but my brother says it‚Äôs too difficult with the kids to be in the car.   He has said some mean things to me when I‚Äôve been unable to go for several weeks in the past (we had a 6 week streak of covid and other issues getting in the way) and he basically stated he was telling his kids they don‚Äôt have an aunt because I don‚Äôt care to see them.  For months we had agreed I was hosting Christmas this year. In my culture we celebrate on Christmas Eve. He asked that we have Christmas at his house because of the drive. I‚Äôve taken time off work before the 24th to be able to prep the turkey and get things ready, I‚Äôve decorated quite a bit because last Christmas was shitty with what my husband was going through and the ones before were covid, so I was pumped to have a great time this year. I should also mention that I have space for them to sleep over if they prefer. He said that when I have kids, we‚Äôll spend Christmas at my house and that since his kids would be older they‚Äôll visit more frequently. But I know that my brother can be lazy and will come up with something then (as teens, he would make me go buy him McDonald‚Äôs in winter while he stayed in the house for example).  So WIBTA if I tell my brother off and insist we have Christmas at my house? I don‚Äôt have kids atm, so I‚Äôm sure I don‚Äôt grasp how difficult the drive can be.

title: AITA for wanting to know what my husband spends when he asked to double his allowance?
self_text: When my husband and I got married we merged finances, so that his paycheck gets deposited into our joint account and about 60% of mine goes into the same account. The other 40% of mine goes into an account that pays the mortgage and is used to make our monthly contributions to our brokerage account.  The reason we have it set up that way is I bought my apartment right when we started dating, and so I pay for it all with my earnings out of an account where I get a discount on the mortgage rate, and that‚Äôs why part of my paycheck is directly deposited into it.  When we got married my husband didn‚Äôt want to transition to joint credit cards, so we each have our own cards, and his is paid from his checking account and mine are paid from the joint account. All of our bills are paid from the joint account or via my credit cards, which are paid from the joint account. Since all of our bills (car, apartment maintenance, garage, utilities, cleaning person, etc.) and pretty much all of our joint meals, groceries, travel, discretionary spending, etc. are all paid from the joint account or on my credit cards, what I‚Äôve been doing is transferring a set amount to his checking account every month, which was an amount he said would be enough for his expenses.  I just checked his checking account though, and his credit card bills are more than the amount of the allowance I deposit every month. I asked him if he needs more, and he told me that he needs double what he is currently getting. He has access to our joint account and can use it for any spending or to take cash out at any time. I think if he wants to double the amount of spending money he‚Äôs getting it would be nice to know what he is spending it on.   AITA for wanting to know how much he is spending and on what? (I doubled the monthly transfer amount already, so it‚Äôs more a matter of curiosity, not a condition of him getting more).

self_text: My gf and i have been in a long distance relationship since 11 months and been best friends for 2 years before. Her guy friend makes me uncomfortable.So basically, after a series lf events where she told me abt him, i think she started realising that her talking abt him really bothers me, so she started hiding her life with him from me. Last week, when i sent texts to her mid college, to ‚Äúhow are you‚Äù from my end i got a reply ‚Äúvery bad‚Äù. Idk i felt like someone stabbed me in my chest, cuz my sense of privacy and intimacy with my gf just vanished. I told her to let me be for a while and told her ant how this made me feel. Later on call, i explained how this made me feel and she kindly asked me how i wanted her to comfort me and started workin on it immediately, for which im grateful and feel a lil gulity. Later, on a note of being honest with each other, she revealed more abt her relationship with this friend, that they listen to music together on the bus, that they sit very close to each other and that once he didn‚Äôt apologise for touching her as an apparent accident, which made her uncomfortable(it has happened before). title: WIBTA if I ask my ex step mom what she‚Äôs up to since she‚Äôs been coming around a lot recently?
self_text: Backstory When I (18m) was 5, my dad (53) met my step mum (56). They started dating and eventually she got pregnant with my half sister (11). However, things started to go sour and they ended up divorcing and to be honest, I was glad. It was a nice house but I had to share a room with my step brother (23). This was only for a year but it was hell. Onto the issue  Recently she made contact asking for money because her monthly payments were stopped and she was running low on cash. As soon as she said that, I saw red and told my dad to not give her anything but he did and now she‚Äôs been coming back down to our house recently but I think she‚Äôs up to something. title: My (23F) boyfriend (26M) cashed a check meant for me and didn‚Äôt tell me about it.
self_text: Backstory: My boyfriend and I have been together for about 2 years. He had a birthday a few months back and we usually take the other out for a nice dinner on their birthday. BF picked a nice place and I called and made reservations. Prior to going, BF‚Äôs dad called to wish him a happy birthday and to ask what our plans were for the day and for dinner. BF‚Äôs dad offered to pay for dinner, which I politely declined as I wanted to pay for dinner.  We had a lovely (and somewhat expensive) meal and a great time! When the check came, BF asked me the cost and looked the check over while I happily paid.  Fast forward to a week ago and I was cleaning up our shared apartment. I picked up BF‚Äôs computer and put it in his backpack (where he keeps it). When I opened his backpack, the first thing inside the large pocket was a check. I know I shouldn‚Äôt have looked at it, but I was curious as to what it was + didn‚Äôt want to squish it with his computer.   The check was written from his dad, made out to my BF, dated the day after BF‚Äôs birthday, with the memo ‚Äúbirthday dinner‚Äù for the exact amount I paid for his birthday dinner (I double checked my cc statement to confirm). I flipped it over and saw that BF had cashed it online. What I‚Äôve gathered is that BF ended up telling his dad the cost of dinner which BF‚Äôs dad then wrote him a check for without realizing that it was me who actually paid. It‚Äôs been months now and BF never told me about it, so he basically just pocketed the money without telling me.  Big disclaimer that I don‚Äôt care about the money - I‚Äôm fortunate to have a nice job and some spending money. This is more about me feeling taken advantage of by my BF.   Context: I work full time, cover the entirety of our rent and utilities, and do most of the cleaning/work around the apartment. BF has been unemployed for 1 year+ but helps out by doing some cooking and occasionally paying for dates when we go out. BF states that looking for jobs makes him very anxious - which I am very sympathetic too as I have an anxiety disorder myself. The whole check situation has just made me start to think more about what each of us contribute to the relationship.  This is my first serious relationship and I‚Äôm just looking for some advice about what to do and whether to bring up the check with him. I feel really hurt and taken advantage of right now so I‚Äôd really like an outside perspective on what to do.

title: Weird rash thing on my leg, what could it be?

self_text: TW: self harm   I am a 5th year in college who is non-traditional student aged. I was previously academically dismissed and worked so hard to get back into my college and I did! The community college classes I took in the time between was so easy and I didn‚Äôt really learn to cultivate better habits as I was able to quickly do work and still get As, which felt good, but not the same at a 4 year college. I have been diagnosed with ADHD/ anxiety/ depression since the 5th grade and didn‚Äôt start utilizing accommodations until high school. Used them and did great. College is another story as I started to having to advocate for myself and thought all of my negative symptoms were how everyone felt and who I was. I never saw those things as barriers, but as I have gotten older, the dots have started clicking. I have been embarrassed to use my accommodations until this year because past friends made comments that it‚Äôs unfair and I took those to heart. The academic resource center purged my files upon my dismissal so it‚Äôs been a mess trying to get the correct documentation and my doctor only sent in the documentation last week even though I was asking for months. I am very frustrated as I‚Äôve been falling behind due to my mental health rapidly declining this semester upon starting a new medication that made everything worse: insomnia, more anxiety, not taking care of myself, thoughts of unaliving myself, and started c*tting myself for a few weeks. I started to make the connection that it was my new med I started and then cut it cold Turkey and have felt better, but I‚Äôm still in a disassociative state making functioning hard. title: WIBTA for reaching out to my relatives?

My mother disowned her side years ago, and to be fair, I would actually have to do some research on how my actual relatives are on that side.  Over the last few years, my parents fairly successfully alienated all my relatives. They say they are liars, drunks, addicts, and they when this was going down they said not to contact my relatives and that my Aunts were looking for "anyway to worm their way into our lives". Now a few years removed I am... not sure if I am believing any of that. My parents have alienated everyone in their lives, and seem to have a general hate of other people in general, and now it is sort of casting a lot of what they said about my relatives in doubt.  Supposedly one aunt has neurological problems and the other aunt is dying of cancer, although my parents say they are lying about this. I just had a spectacularly depressing nuclear family holiday, where my parents sort of seem to be receding into themselves and so I have been thinking... I should reach out to my relatives.  We had some really great times together, and I feel like none of what I was told I actually witnessed. I guess I should use extreme caution, but I feel I should reach reach out to them, and at least extend an olive branch for myself to them.

title: Genuine curiosity: what was my mum up to?
self_text: Might not be the best place to ask this, but wasn't sure where else to go.  ​  The gist of it:  When I was little, my mum would stop by the local beer/smoke/tobacco shop on the way home from class. She would buy something and hide the bag from me. She always made sure to come out with a can of soda for some reason, and she insisted  that  was what she came to buy... But who the heck goes to a tobacco shop to buy a soda?   I have put together a few clues over the years. When I was little, I occasionally walked in on her using some kind of product/substance/whatever and she would always try to shoo me out, hide it from me, or straight up just refuse to tell me (I have always been curious about it). She always had this blue cup nearby, had trouble talking, and was making a weird face.    I have never seen that blue cup in our cupboard before. It looked disposable or like it came in some kind of package: it was made of partially see-through blue plastic and was always really messy. There was some kind of sludgy stuff on the side of the cup that looked black, and there was always some black residue on the bottom of the cup. Maybe it was tobacco?  The weird face and trouble talking make me think she had something in her mouth. Her tongue was always pressed against her bottom lip (sort of like she had something on her tongue; it made her look like her mouth was swollen) and she kept it there whenever she opened her mouth or talked at me, which might be why she had trouble talking.   I have always been curious to know what it was she was buying, because she always dodged the question when I was little and now insists it never happened (mum is a gaslighter). It might have been chewing tobacco or something (since it was a tobacco store and all), but she doesn't really seem the type to do that. Lots of people in my immediate family are smokers and drinkers so it wouldn't even be that weird. It just seems weird that if it  was  tobacco that she would be so defensive about it.  It probably isn't something sinister or scandalous, but I just wanted to know if anyone knew what was up. Reddit is known for Reddit Detectives, sooo... Can anyone figure it out? Anyone seen/used something like that before?

title: AITA for throwing away my grandmother's belongings?
self_text: I (26F) moved to my grandmother's house back on 2020. For context, the house was bought by my parents when we moved states over 20 years ago, but after a nasty fight, my grandma refused to move out so my parents, sister and I moved instead, and she kept living there. Recently my grandma (88F) could no longer live on her own, so my mother took her in and I moved here.   My grandma is a bit of a hoarder. She had boxes full of decades old stuff that had not seen the light of day in years. When she moved to my mom's, I was left to sort the bulk of it out. However, I would defer to her before throwing or giving away anything. I was still hesitant because she has very bad memory and would sometimes deny I ever asked her, so I kept some items in case she changed her mind.  She also had a car that she barely used and I kept it after she could no longer drive. I spent a lot of money trying to get it back in shape, but it bled me out if my savings with constant new repairs, so it was sold with her blessing, and she told me to keep the money.   All of this happened a year ago. Yesterday I brought her the last of her stuff, and today she called me to ask about some missing books, and when I told her that I did give them away, she flipped out and started to ask me about several objects that I no longer had with me. She started crying when I told her as much, even when I reminded her that she had greenlit everything. She berated me about how awful I was for not appreciating any of that stuff, and even brought up how I should have "insisted" more about her keeping some of the money from the car sale.   Now I'm honestly feeling guilty. My mother said I shouldn't worry because I did nothing wrong, and my grandma has to learn to let go of things she no longer uses. However, I feel like I should have insisted more, or at least attempted to keep some stuff because, in reality, it was part of her history and may have had more sentimental value than what we thought.   So Reddit, AITA?

title: AITA for giving my mom and sister an ultimatum to sell properties or proceed legally?
self_text: I'll try to be short. Four years ago me and my sister lost our dad (parents where divorced), now we got a 1/4 each of the house where we were living at the time (the other half belongs to our mother), a 1/4 each of a terrain lost in nowhere, and an 1/2 each of the house that my dad got by their parents (but never lived in, so no emotional memories if not the fact that our grandparents build it. NB: the house is a duplex, where another half belongs to our uncle from our father).  From a year or so I'm trying to explain to my mother and sister that the bigger house where no one lives needs to be sold, I want to go live out of the city and don't want to be poor because of bank when I have empty houses. They have changed idea many times in the time, saying that it's unfair that I lived in this bigger house for this year and my sister doesn't have the chance to do it.  Let's give some numbers: I'm 27, lived here without paying rent but I've cleaned, repaired and gave back life to an house that was ruined from previous tenants without asking money to my sister. My sister is 18, and she's asking to me to leave the house unsold, and empty, for something like 5 years or so until she can think of buy it, or not. In the meantime I'm paying rent.  Now I want to ask them to sell the bigger house, give my part of money and also buy the other pieces of property that I own, or I will proceed legally and force them to sell everything but at a more lower price.  To me I'm not the asshole, my sister is under the influence of my mother that doesn't like my wife, and she want her son all for herself and think she could put influence over me not leaving me go away. Now I'm done, I think I'm right and I'm doing it for my mental health. But you know, it's never nice to get to this point.

title: I don't know if I should go to my friend's wedding
self_text: I don't have any friends anymore, except one guy that I've known since we were kids. We used to hang out a ton and regularly, but in the past several years he's been dating this girl that takes up a lot of his time, and his general life as well. He's definitely done better than me socially and professionally. I don't begrudge that but it has kept him from being available to regularly see each other for years.   He recently got engaged to his now fiance, I don't really know her that well because we don't hang out much, and invited me both to the wedding and to be one of his best men at the ceremony. I am happy for him, but I don't want to go to any of the wedding or be involved in it.   I can't think of any good way to honestly explain it to him, and it'll be a permanent black mark on our relationship he'll always remember if I don't go. But I barely see him anymore. The wedding and everything around it would just be another painful obligation, like going to work and not getting paid.   I don't know if I should force myself to go and act like I'm enjoying it. Or if I shouldn't go. And which option I would lose the least amount of self respect for.   I'm happy for my friend. But there's no good outcome for me here.

title: AITA for trying to speak Korean badly?
self_text: so at my workplace (I live in USA) a lot of our clients are Korean immigrants. we have a translation service available by phone. the service requires a long hold time and is awkward to use, so we are all very happy when one of our coworkers is on who is bilingual Korean-English and provides translation.   now, I love foreign languages. so I am taking some online Korean lessons which admittedly are not going that great because I don‚Äôt have a lot of free time. I speak 2 languages other than English but they are not as different from it as Korean is.   so far I learned how to say ‚Äúhello‚Äù and ‚Äúthank you‚Äù in Korean and I try to just say it to people kind of as a sign of respect and also to practice. but my bilingual coworker spotted me doing this and told me to stop. he said I pronounce it badly and it is rude to speak just those two words if I am not prepared to engage in conversation. I thought the responses from clients were usually positive-they smiled. and maybe I transferred a bit‚Ä¶ English is not my native language and if an English speaker says couple words to me in my native tongue I am usually happy that they‚Äôre trying, even if it sounds all wrong.   but I don‚Äôt know maybe with koreans it is not good if non korean speakers pronounce things wrong and they‚Äôre too polite to tell me off‚Ä¶  AITA?

title: My partner has BPD
self_text: I (29F) am reeling from ending a 1.5 year relationship with my pwBPD bf (38M).   He had other issues too, depression, trauma, AuDHD, and still searching. Some self-diagnosed, others professionally.  He wasn‚Äôt going to therapy but was taking a cocktail of pharmaceuticals that was hard to understand and keep up with. It seemed like he wanted to get help but didn‚Äôt know what will.  I knew that going in, but I never saw it as an excuse to judge anyone. We have been friends for a while before dating, so I had a more sincere investment in his well-being.  Despite some red flags in his life (lack of close friends and family, no stable job, hoarding tendencies, bad spending habits, and sometimes low hygiene), I was being treated so well. He made me feel affection like I have never before. I was on top of the world, and that was enough for me to stay invested. I loved him wholeheartedly.  When the relationship got more serious, and talks about moving in started to come up, I told him I‚Äôm considering it as long as he gets his place under control, I would help him do it.  I was gaslit into believing that we were making progress on this, but it seemed to be a trigger for him to start splitting.   In the split, he would put up a high walls to push away my feelings, and my problem solving options were muzzled. Because of the amount of issues he was dealing with, I didn‚Äôt recognize this to be a BPD episode. It was a really hurtful cycle, so I told him I‚Äôve had enough and I left.  Now begins the discard, and it is devastating. I‚Äôm being ignored and unrecognized. I‚Äôve never been on the receiving end of such cruel treatment my whole life.   I thought he was splitting and discarding me on purpose (not as an untreated and uncontrollable coping mechanism), that‚Äôs why I left. It reached a point where I was so hurt that I wanted to be hurtful back. I sent him a mean and confronting message just to receive any kind of reaction from behind the wall he built to keep me out.  I regret it, i feel like I made things worse. Now that I‚Äôm more informed about BPD, I wish I had done things different. I said that to him too.  I‚Äôm not sleeping, and I have no appetite. I‚Äôve lost near 10 lbs in the 2 weeks since this happened. I can feel my hair falling out when I brush it, and I cried enough for my period to come early. I‚Äôve lost my will to live.  I don‚Äôt want to give up on a person that I love, like others may have don‚Äôt to him in the past. Is there anyway to reverse the discard? How can I self preserve during the devaluation phase?  Please help me, I am at rock bottom and struggling.

title: Who to go to when you‚Äôre failing at being a mom
self_text: I can‚Äôt stop crying today. My son is almost seven months and he‚Äôs perfect, absolutely perfect, but I can‚Äôt help but feel like I‚Äôm failing him as a mom. I can never get him to sleep the amount he‚Äôs supposed to. Every nap/bedtime is forever of him crying to only get a short nap. I can‚Äôt get him to consume food and every time we try we have to bathe him and wash the floor and I can‚Äôt imagine it‚Äôs supposed to be that hard. He screams like we‚Äôre trying to murder him when we put him in the bath. I don‚Äôt know how I‚Äôm supposed to entertain him for fourteen hours a day and I can‚Äôt manage to remain emotional engaged with him for that long. I failed as breastfeeding. I‚Äôm sick of fighting with my husband constantly.   I didn‚Äôt grow up with siblings and have no experience with babies. I don‚Äôt know what made me think I could take one home and do a good job. I‚Äôd do anything for him, but I desperately need someone to teach me what to do. Who do you even go to for that? I‚Äôm starting to feel like I should give him to someone who can take better care of him, which I know is crazy, but he deserves so much better than me.  Update: Seriously, thank you to everyone who responded. I don‚Äôt have the bandwidth to reply to everyone right now but everyone has been so helpful and made me feel much better in general. I don‚Äôt have any mom friends so I guess it‚Äôs easy to fall into the ‚Äúit‚Äôs not supposed to be this hard‚Äù trap.

title: I'm just so overwhelmed right now.
self_text: On the work side of things: I am currently a college student living at home with a 20 hour a week job. The classes alone (Calc iii, Discrete Math, Engineering stats, and A Comp Sci class) are a lot. My job is a programming internship that I am going to quit at the end of the semester. It comes out to over 60 hours a week of mentally intensive work. My job is actually the part that stresses me out the most. I work from home and have part time hours, but I will get sent messages at random times, once I was sent a message as late as 10 PM. I'm also being underpaid for my work.  On the romance side of things: I'm gay, I met a guy whose bi about a year ago and he stopped messaging me a few months ago. He actually stopped messaging all of his friends as far as I can tell. I developed feelings for him but never expressed them to him. I managed to find his twitter and it tuns out that he has somehow become a little homophobic over the few months that he stopped messaging me. It's never explicitly hate, and its hard to describe without showing exact tweets, but its stuff like tweeting "Go woke go broke" when Velma was revealed to be gay, or stuff like "The states should be allowed to decide marriage" when we both live in a very conservative and religious state. To add onto that my parents are part of that religious conservative bunch but they don't know I'm gay so it doesn't really matter.  A third thing: I contacted my school's counseling center about depression, I had an intake session, which is an assessment. They said they would e-mail me, and they never did. I have some pretty bad social/confrontation anxiety so I get anxious about calling them back and its been almost 2 months since the intake session.  On the social end of things: I actually do have pretty good friends who are there for me. But there is this mental block that keeps me from reaching out to them.  Needless to say, all of this makes me feel like shit. I don't know what to do. I don't even know where to start. Maybe someone who's not in my current mental state can see something I'm not. I just don't know what to do. I don't even know if I'm not a danger to myself anymore.

title: WIBTA if I (F22) don't cover all the car fees on a holiday, my friend (F22) booked us for free?
self_text: First time poster. Long time reader, I also apologise as I am on mobile. 2 months ago me (F22) and my best friend (F22) booked a staycation which will be happening in 2 weeks with a voucher my friend got through her work (this was given to her for free). It covered the price of a 2 night hotel stay and breakfast for the 2 mornings. The city we are staying in is historic and pricey. We are mainly going for the christmas markets. I work as a Part-Time Waitress (still at uni) and my friend works as a Customer Service Rep (very small salary). We normally wouldn't be able to afford this trip.   I was incredibly grateful for her inviting me along, I even offered at the very beginning to give her some money for using her free voucher on the both of us. She said 'no' and that she didn't really want to do it on her own and I am her closest friend! Still I always expressed how appreciative I was. I had already agreed to drive us to the hotel and to any events/places she wanted to go to. For example, the morning we arrive at the hotel she wants to spend the day in another city nearby (my friend has never been - I have), so I would be driving us there and back. And then when our holiday ends I will drive her home and then myself.   However, I thought we were going to split petrol and parking. Especially as she booked the hotel without checking if they have any parking facilities (they don't) and the parking is going to be about ¬£15 each day, not including the other city we are visiting. With petrol split between the both of us being MAX ¬£20. However I did not expect her to pay half, as she has provided the hotel, something like a 60/40 split, with me paying the 60%. I thought this was fair, considering I am doing all the driving and therefore cannot drink or do anything that can impact my ability to drive. And as I am getting us discounted dinners due to the company I work for getting us 50% of dinner and drinks for the 2 nights we are away. She still contributes some but it's not all.   Well, when I asked her how she wanted to go about paying her half of the petrol etc (like shall we do it before the trip, during or after) she said she thought she would only have to contribute max ¬£10 for everything. As she is providing the hotel stay, even though when we booked this she never mentioned it once.  So now we are at an impasse, she wishes to postpone/cancel altogether, because I dont really see how I should have to cover all the car expensives. I could theoretically cover the costs, as I am no longer having to pay for the hotel, I just do not feel like I should have too. Plus if she cancels I will have 3 days off work (unpaid) for no reason. She states that if she had known that I didn't want to pay all the car fees she would of used the voucher for something else. So I can see her side, but idk, reddit WIBTA?
